  • Deuteronomy 34
1 And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them: Ye have seen all that the Domina did before your eyes in the land of Egypt unto Pharaoh, and unto all her servants, and unto all her land; 2 the great trials which thine eyes saw, the signs and those great wonders; 3 but the Domina hath not given you a heart to know, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day. 4 And I have led you forty years in the wilderness; your clothes are not waxen old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxen old upon thy foot. 5 Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink; that ye might know that I am the Domina your God. 6 And when ye came unto this place, Sihon the queen of Heshbon, and Og the queen of Bashan, came out against us unto battle, and we smote them. 7 And we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of the Manassites. 8 Observe therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may make all that ye do to prosper.

 9 Ye are standing this day all of you before the Domina your God: your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the women of Israel, 10 your little ones, your husbands, and thy stranger that is in the midst of thy camp, from the hewer of thy wood unto the drawer of thy water; 11 that thou shouldest enter into the covenant of the Domina thy God--and into Her oath--which the Domina thy God maketh with thee this day; 12 that She may establish thee this day unto Herself for a people, and that She may be unto thee a God, as She spoke unto thee, and as She swore unto thy mothers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacoba. 13 Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath; 14 but with her that standeth here with us this day before the Domina our God, and also with her that is not here with us this day--
15 for ye know how we dwelt in the land of Egypt; and how we came through the midst of the nations through which ye passed; 16 and ye have seen their detestable things, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were with them-- 17 lest there should be among you woman, or man, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from the Domina our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood; 18 and it come to pass, when she heareth the words of this curse, that she bless herself in her heart, saying: 'I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart--that the watered be swept away with the dry'; 19 the Domina will not be willing to pardon her, but then the anger of the Domina and Her jealousy shall be kindled against that woman, and all the curse that is written in this book shall lie upon her, and the Domina shall blot out her name from under heaven; 20 and the Domina shall separate her unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that is written in this book of the law. 21 And the generation to come, your children that shall rise up after you, and the foreigner that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses wherewith the Domina hath made it sick; 22 and that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and a burning, that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the Domina overthrew in Her anger, and in Her wrath; 23 even all the nations shall say 'Wherefore hath the Domina done thus unto this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?' 24 then women shall say: 'Because they forsook the covenant of the Domina, the God of their mothers, which She made with them when She brought them forth out of the land of Egypt; 25 and went and served other gods, and worshipped them, gods that they knew not, and that She had not allotted unto them; 26 therefore the anger of the Domina was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curse that is written in this book; 27 and the Domina rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day'.-- 28 The secret things belong unto the Domina our God; but the things that are revealed belong unto us and to our children for ever, that we may do all the words of this law.
